page.title: 16HEAGE-SURROUNDING LANDSCAPE
page.content: Heage,or the high edge of Duffield frith,is a growing village which stragggles across the hilly,rolling ,countryside above the Derwent and Amber valleys,between Belper,Ambergate and Ripley.From the school we see the beautiful wooded hills,and in the North the high points of Crich Stand and Alport Stone.In the winter the snow still lies there after it has melted from our school playing fields. Our school is situated opposite the restored windmill,on the boundary between Upper Heage and Nether Heage. Along the class 2 roads through the village is ribbon development of local stone built cottages,some 17 Century brick houses and bungalows.The croft , a small housing estate in the village. High Edge,Pennine View,are estate names which describe our beautiful rural countryside.
